articles.title: Paloma Cartwright
articles.description: Master of Environmental Data Science Candidate.
articles.contents:
Personal Profile:
Master of Environmental Data Science Candidate at the Bren School for Environment Science and Management, University of California, Santa Barbara. Completed BA in Computer Science and Environment at McGill University in June 2021. Member of Bahamas National Sailing Team campaigning for 2024 Olympic Games with Bahamas Nacra 17 Racing Team
Academic Background:
Master of Environmental Data Science Candidate
Bren School of Environmental Science and Management, UC Santa Barbara
Expected June 2022


Bachelor of Arts in Computer Science and Environment
McGill University
Completed June 2021


Web Development with Java Script Certification
Lighthouse Labs, Montreal QC
March - April 2020


“Habla Ya” Spanish Immersion School
Costa Rica
March - April 2015


Professional Experience:
Certified Instructor – Bahamas National Sailing School
2014 – Present
Teaching sailing to children ages 8 – 16 in various sailboats at all levels of experience. Organized and directed of 1st Annual Mack Knowles Junior Sailing Club Summer Sailing Camp, leading a team of 5 Instructors and over 75 children.


Information Technology Coordinator – Long Island Boat Rentals
2016 – Present
Coordinator for all technological aspects for the business including web development and social media management


Social Coordinator – McGill Caribbean Student Society Sept.
2020 – 2021
Executive team member and head organizer for all events hosted by the Caribbean Student Society


Intern – Bimini Biological Field Station Foundation
June and July 2019
Summer Intern at the Bimini Sharklab studying the marine environment around Bimini and the interactions of the animals that reside there, focusing primarily on Sharks and Stingrays.


Junior Director of Tourism – Ministry of Tourism, Bahamas
2016 – 2017
Deputy Junior Minister of Tourism for the Bahamas and Junior Director of Tourism for Long Island.


Skills:
Proficient in Java, Python, CSS, HTML and Java Script coding languages - Web Development with Java Script Certified
CPR and First Aid Certified
IANTD (Scuba) Certified
Excellent LEadership and Communication Skills
Strong Research and Analytical Skills
Accomplishments:
Bimini Sharklab Alf Thompson Memorial Scholarship Recipient 2019
Marjorie Davis Award: Top National Exam Results – Bahamas Government Schools 2018
National Top Female Sailor Under 18 Years Old, Bahamas (Optimist, Sunfish, Laser) 2010 - 2018
All Bahamas Merit Scholar (Top Bahamas Ministry of Education Scholarship) 2017
James McGill Entrance Scholarship 2017
Long Island District Valedictorian 2017
Qualified for Laser Youth World Championships, Ireland 2016
Bahamas National Sailing Team, Canadian Olympic Regatta Kingston 2016
2nd Place – Junior Minister of Tourism Competition Bahamas 2016
Bahamas Olympic Committee “President’s Cup”, National Youth Awards 2015
“Excellence in Sailing Award”, National Youth Awards 2015
Bahamas National Spelling Bee Champion 2012
Scripps National Spelling Bee Participant, Washington, DC, USA 2012

articles.title: Paloma Cartwright
articles.contents:
Paloma Cartwright completed her Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Environment at McGill University in June 2021. Growing up in The Bahamas, spending most of her days in or on the ocean, her passion for nature developed from an early age. She also experienced first hand the impacts of climate change on her home. Throughout her undergraduate career, she completed internships with the Bahamas Sea Turtle Research Institute and the Bimini Biological Field Station Foundation - Sharklab studying varying species of marine life. After graduation, Paloma seeked to bridge the gap between her two disciplines and enrolled in the Master of Environmental Data Science program at the Bren School of Environmental Science and Management. She understands how both computer science and environmental disciplines will be crucial to finding solutions for climate change impacts in The Bahamas. Currently, her interests lie in renewable energy and climate change mitigation. Her long-term goal is to use data science to advance solutions to the environmental problems faced by The Bahamas.
